alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 10:57PM EST until January 07 at 11:48PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues or the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston down to Hazleton. Wabash River at Lafayette down to Riverton. Mississinewa River at Ridgeville. .Antecedent soil moisture...and upwards of an additional one and a half inches of rainfall this weekend...has returned several rivers to flood. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Old Vincennes Road and State Road 358 in Daviess County and Schaefer Road in Knox County are impassable. High water affects agricultural bottomlands. During agricultural season this level is of concern to farmers on the unprotected areas along the river. High water affects river cabins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Saturday /6:00 PM CST Saturday/ the stage was 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Saturday /6:00 PM CST Saturday/ was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall to 17.0 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 17.1 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning to 10.0 feet and begin rising again Monday, January 10. It will rise to 11.3 feet Monday, January 10. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by noon Sunday.
